ovdesc.p: This table contains all the Local Stock Exchange Commissions and Fees as payable on the SWITZERLAND Stock Exchange.

It contains standard default Category and Transaction codes for all P&L related entries as well as the various bands at which different percentages are to be applied and the asset type to which those rates refer.
Additionally, it allows the user to store whenever possible the minimum charges payable within that specified Stock Exchange.

It must be pointed out that whereas the system is completely flexible regarding the different levels and rates applicable - a change in the fundamental calculation process would inevitably lead to a program change.

desc.p: Used to store the minimum commission payable on shares or bonds traded in Switzerland.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 18.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on trust and certificate type securities.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default value for minimum charge payable on certificates and trust like securities traded in Switzerland.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default debit transaction code for all commissions levied from a customer and contained within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1) 1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
No input field. Field automatically defaults to currency of the country as specified at ID.
3 type CCY (Currency Code) characters. (Default Value).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 16.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on notes and schuldsheine type securities.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with fields 21 and 22 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign shares traded abroad.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Specifies the country domicile to which the rates and commissions applicable within any particular stock exchange apply.

Notes: At Stock.Exchange the user is prompted for a (CALL>COUNTRY) ID at Field 3. Whenever a transactio is entered with a given stock exchange the system will read the appropriate stock exchange calculation tables.
It is possible to have 2 or more stock exchanges reading the same calculation table eg. Basle, Geneva and Zurich.
2 type SS (uppercase alpha) country code characters. (Mandatory Input).
Must exist on the COUNTRY.CODE table.
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 13.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on Swiss domiciled bonds.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Debit transaction code for all brokerage type P & L entries created within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1) 1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 10.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign domiciled shares.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 14.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign domiciled bonds.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 12.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on Swiss domiciled bonds.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Minimum amounts can be fixed at will for all transactions having a gross value of less than SFR 250.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 19.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on trusts and certificate type securities.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default credit transaction code for all commission levied from a customer and contained within this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1) 1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Standard default value for all transactions effected abroad i.e. the minimum charge payable by a client no matter how small the gross consideration.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with Field 11.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign domiciled shares.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Credit transaction code for all brokerage P & L type entries which will be created by this application.
The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities.
1) 1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 8.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on Swiss domiciled shares.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 15.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign domiciled bonds.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 20 & 22 to store the different levels and rates applicable on foreign shares traded abroad.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default category code for all commission levied from a customer according to the rates as stored within this application.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 17.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on notes and schuldscheine type securities.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 9.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on Swiss domiciled shares.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Default value for minimum charge payable on all transactions in foreign currency bonds, notes and promissory notes.
1-14 type amount (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 24.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on Bonds traded abroad.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Multivalue field to be used in conjunction with field 23.1 to store the different levels and rates applicable on bonds traded abroad.
1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
Default category code for all brokerage type entries contained within these tables.

This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation.
4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
